Sweet

              that

              a

speaker: VALENTINE
text:
Ah
              ,
               
              Sylvia
              ,
               
              Sylvia
              !

speaker: SPEED
text: Madam Sylvia! Madam Sylvia!

speaker: VALENTINE
text: How now, sirrah?

speaker: SPEED
text: She is not within hearing, sir.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: Why, sir, who bade you call her?

speaker: SPEED
text: Your Worship, sir, or else I mistook.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: Well, you’ll still be too forward.

speaker: SPEED
text: And yet I was last chidden for being too slow.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: Go to, sir. Tell me, do you know Madam

speaker: VALENTINE
text: Sylvia?

speaker: SPEED
text: She that your Worship loves?

speaker: VALENTINE
text: Why, how know you that I am in love?

speaker: SPEED
text: Marry, by these special marks: first, you have

speaker: SPEED
text: learned, like Sir Proteus, to wreathe your arms like

speaker: SPEED
text: a malcontent; to relish a love song like a robin

speaker: SPEED
text: redbreast; to walk alone like one that had the

speaker: SPEED
text: pestilence; to sigh like a schoolboy that had lost his

speaker: SPEED
text: ABC; to weep like a young wench that had buried

speaker: SPEED
text: her grandam; to fast like one that takes diet; to

speaker: SPEED
text: watch like one that fears robbing; to speak puling

speaker: SPEED
text: like a beggar at Hallowmas. You were wont, when

speaker: SPEED
text: you laughed, to crow like a cock; when you walked,

speaker: SPEED
text: to walk like one of the lions. When you fasted, it was

speaker: SPEED
text: presently after dinner; when you looked sadly, it

speaker: SPEED
text: was for want of money. And now you are metamorphosed

speaker: SPEED
text: with a mistress, that when I look on you, I

speaker: SPEED
text: can hardly think you my master.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: Are all these things perceived in me?

speaker: SPEED
text: They are all perceived without you.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: Without me? They cannot.

speaker: SPEED
text: Without you? Nay, that’s certain, for without

speaker: SPEED
text: you were so simple, none else would. But you are so

speaker: SPEED
text: without these follies, that these follies are within

speaker: SPEED
text: you and shine through you like the water in an

speaker: SPEED
text: urinal, that not an eye that sees you but is a

speaker: SPEED
text: physician to comment on your malady.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: But tell me, dost thou know my Lady

speaker: VALENTINE
text: Sylvia?

speaker: SPEED
text: She that you gaze on so as she sits at supper?

speaker: VALENTINE
text: Hast thou observed that? Even she I mean.

speaker: SPEED
text: Why, sir, I know her not.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: Dost thou know her by my gazing on her

speaker: VALENTINE
text: and yet know’st her not?

speaker: SPEED
text: Is she not hard-favored, sir?

speaker: VALENTINE
text: Not so fair, boy, as well-favored.

speaker: SPEED
text: Sir, I know that well enough.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: What dost thou know?

speaker: SPEED
text: That she is not so fair as, of you, well-favored.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: I mean that her beauty is exquisite but her

speaker: VALENTINE
text: favor infinite.

speaker: SPEED
text: That’s because the one is painted, and the other

speaker: SPEED
text: out of all count.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: How painted? And how out of count?

speaker: SPEED
text: Marry, sir, so painted to make her fair, that no

speaker: SPEED
text: man counts of her beauty.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: How esteem’st thou me? I account of her

speaker: VALENTINE
text: beauty.

speaker: SPEED
text: You never saw her since she was deformed.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: How long hath she been deformed?

speaker: SPEED
text: Ever since you loved her.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: I have loved her ever since I saw her, and

speaker: VALENTINE
text: still I see her beautiful.

speaker: SPEED
text: If you love her, you cannot see her.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: Why?

speaker: SPEED
text: Because love is blind. O, that you had mine eyes,

speaker: SPEED
text: or your own eyes had the lights they were wont to

speaker: SPEED
text: have when you chid at Sir Proteus for going

speaker: SPEED
text: ungartered!

speaker: VALENTINE
text: What should I see then?

speaker: SPEED
text: Your own present folly and her passing deformity;

speaker: SPEED
text: for he, being in love, could not see to garter his

speaker: SPEED
text: hose, and you, being in love, cannot see to put on

speaker: SPEED
text: your hose.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: Belike, boy, then you are in love, for last

speaker: VALENTINE
text: morning you could not see to wipe my shoes.

speaker: SPEED
text: True, sir, I was in love with my bed. I thank you,

speaker: SPEED
text: you swinged me for my love, which makes me the

speaker: SPEED
text: bolder to chide you for yours.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: In conclusion, I stand affected to her.

speaker: SPEED
text: I would you were set, so your affection would

speaker: SPEED
text: cease.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: Last night she enjoined me to write some

speaker: VALENTINE
text: lines to one she loves.

speaker: SPEED
text: And have you?

speaker: VALENTINE
text: I have.

speaker: SPEED
text: Are they not lamely writ?

speaker: VALENTINE
text: No, boy, but as well as I can do them.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: Peace, here she comes.

speaker: SPEED
text: O excellent motion! O exceeding puppet!

speaker: SPEED
text: Now will he interpret to her.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: Madam and mistress, a thousand

speaker: VALENTINE
text: good-morrows.

speaker: SPEED
text: O, give ye good ev’n! Here’s a million of

speaker: SPEED
text: manners.

speaker: SYLVIA
text: Sir Valentine, and servant, to you two

speaker: SYLVIA
text: thousand.

speaker: SPEED
text: He should give her interest, and she

speaker: SPEED
text: gives it him.

O

              ,

speaker: SPEED

As
               
              a

              ,

              ,
               
              to

              .

speaker: SPEED
text:
O
               
              excellent
               
              device
              !
               
              Was
               
              there
               
              ever

              a

              ?

speaker: SPEED
text:
That
               
              my
               
              master
              ,
               
              being
               
              scribe
              ,
               
              to

              should
               
              write
               
              the
               
              letter
              ?

speaker: VALENTINE
text: How now, sir? What, are you reasoning

speaker: VALENTINE
text: with yourself?

speaker: SPEED
text: Nay, I was rhyming. ’Tis you that have the

speaker: SPEED
text: reason.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: To do what?

speaker: SPEED
text: To be a spokesman from Madam Sylvia.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: To whom?

speaker: SPEED
text: To yourself. Why, she woos you by a figure.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: What figure?

speaker: SPEED
text: By a letter, I should say.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: Why, she hath not writ to me!

speaker: SPEED
text: What need she when she hath made you write

speaker: SPEED
text: to yourself? Why, do you not perceive the jest?

speaker: VALENTINE
text: No, believe me.

speaker: SPEED
text: No believing you indeed, sir. But did you perceive

speaker: SPEED
text: her earnest?

speaker: VALENTINE
text: She gave me none, except an angry word.

speaker: SPEED
text: Why, she hath given you a letter.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: That’s the letter I writ to her friend.

speaker: SPEED
text: And that letter hath she delivered, and there an

speaker: SPEED
text: end.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: I would it were no worse.

speaker: SPEED
text: I’ll warrant you, ’tis as well.

speaker: SPEED
text: All this I speak in print, for in print I found it. Why

speaker: SPEED
text: muse you, sir? ’Tis dinnertime.

speaker: VALENTINE
text: I have dined.

speaker: SPEED
text: Ay, but hearken, sir, though the chameleon love

speaker: SPEED
text: can feed on the air, I am one that am nourished by

speaker: SPEED
text: my victuals and would fain have meat. O, be not like

speaker: SPEED
text: your mistress! Be moved, be moved.
